text: Most of the top earners worked at B.C. Investment Management Corporation and other Crown corporations.
All 13 of the topâ€“paid university staff were from UBC. There was only one woman among them.
Women were concentrated in the low end of the salary spectrum. Half the men in the top 100 earned more than $500,000. Only 30% of women did.

B.C. is one of only four provinces without provincial pay equity legislation, which requires employers to give equal pay to women and men for equal work. B.C. also has one of the largest gaps in gender pay, according to Statistics Canada.
